vague_description: A fashion company must determine the optimal number of regular and premium handbags to sell within budgetary and sales constraints to maximize monthly profit.
detailed_description: A fashion company sells regular handbags and premium handbags made of higher quality material. They can sell regular handbags at a profit of \param{ProfitRegular} each and premium handbags at a profit of \param{ProfitPremium} each. The total monthly cost of manufacturing is \param{CostRegular} per regular handbag and \param{CostPremium} per premium handbag. The company has a total budget of \param{Budget} and can sell at most \param{MaxHandbags} handbags of either type per month. How many of each handbag should they sell to maximize its monthly profit?
target_objective: Maximize the company's monthly profit from selling regular and premium handbags
target_constraints: Number of regular handbags sold is non-negative
Number of premium handbags sold is non-negative
Total cost of manufacturing regular handbags plus premium handbags cannot exceed Budget
Total number of handbags sold cannot exceed MaxHandbags per month
target_parameters: Cost of manufacturing a regular handbag
Cost of manufacturing a premium handbag
Maximum number of handbags that can be sold per month
